turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Canberra Airport.
turn.1: What was the main cause of the Canberra Airport access problems?
turn.2: The road approaches to the airport and business parks have historically been prone to traffic congestion in peak times.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: In 2007, the Chief Minister, Jon Stanhope controversially attributed the congestion to the Federal Government permitting construction of office buildings on airport land.
turn.5: Was there ever any change or reform?
turn.6: A report commissioned by the ACT Government however identified a range of factors contributing including population growth in Gungahlin and Queanbeyan and the expansion of the airport itself, calling for a staged approach to road improvements in the area.
turn.7: Did the government do anything to fix the problem?
turn.8: Major investment in upgrades aimed at improving access have progressively been completed since 2008 through joint funding from both Canberra Airport Group and the ACT Government.
turn.9: What did the public do to help?
turn.10: Canberra Cabs and partner taxi companies provide services to the airport taxi rank.
turn.12: An enclosed waiting area was opened in November 2013, aiming to improve the experience for arriving passengers who would otherwise wait outside in Canberra's relative climate extremes.
